title: Understand the Binomial Coefficient Notation
text: The notation C(n,k), or the binomial coefficient, represents the number of ways to choose k items from a group of $$n$$ items without regard to the order of selection.

title: Recall the Formula for Binomial Coefficients
text: The formula for calculating C(n,k) is $$\frac{n!}{k!(n-k)!}.$$ This formula uses factorials to determine the number of combinations.

title: Calculate 17!
text: Start by calculating the factorial for $$17$$. What is $$17$$ factorial, or 17!?

title: Calculate 6!
text: Next, calculate the factorial for $$6$$. What is $$6$$ factorial, or 6!?

title: Calculate $$(17-6)!$$
text: Now, find the factorial for the difference $$(17-6)$$. What is $$(17-6)$$ factorial, or 11!?

title: Apply the Formula
text: Using the values you've calculated, apply them to the formula C(n,k) $$=$$ n!/(k!*(n-k)!). What do you get for $$C(17,6)$$?
